org.gwtbootstrap3.client.ui
Class Tooltip

java.lang.Object
  org.gwtbootstrap3.client.ui.Tooltip
All Implemented Interfaces:
com.google.gwt.user.client.ui.AcceptsOneWidget, com.google.gwt.user.client.ui.HasOneWidget, com.google.gwt.user.client.ui.HasWidgets, com.google.gwt.user.client.ui.IsWidget, Iterable<com.google.gwt.user.client.ui.Widget>, HasHover, HasId
public class Tooltip
extends Object
implements com.google.gwt.user.client.ui.IsWidget, com.google.gwt.user.client.ui.HasWidgets, com.google.gwt.user.client.ui.HasOneWidget, HasId, HasHover

Basic implementation for the Bootstrap tooltip

Bootstrap Documentation

UiBinder example

 <b:Tooltip text="...">
    ...
 </b:Tooltip>

** Must call reconfigure() after altering any/all Tooltips!

Author:
Joshua Godi, Pontus Enmark

getAlternateTemplate

public String getAlternateTemplate()
Get the alternate template used to render the tooltip. If null, the default template will be used.

Returns:
String the alternate template used to render the tooltip

setAlternateTemplate

public void setAlternateTemplate(String alternateTemplate)
Set the alternate template used to render the tooltip. The template should contain divs with classes 'tooltip', 'tooltip-inner', and 'tooltip-arrow'. If an alternate template is configured, the 'tooltipClassNames', 'tooltipArrowClassNames', and 'tooltipInnerClassNames' properties are not used.

Parameters:
alternateTemplate - the alternate template used to render the tooltip

reconfigure

public void reconfigure()
Reconfigures the tooltip, must be called when altering any tooltip after it has already been shown

protected String prepareTemplate()
